newsitem.title: UK: Co-Op says no sale planned to Lanica.
newsitem.headline: Co-Op says no sale planned to Lanica.

text.p: The Co-Operative Wholesale Society Ltd (CWS) said on Monday that it had "no plans to dispose of CWS businesses or assets" to Lanica Trust or its head Andre Regan.
CWS was responding to a statement from Lanica on Sunday that a company in which it had an investment would approach CWS to discuss the possible purchase of non-food businesses.
CWS said in a statement that it had not been in talks with Regan and had no prior notification from him.

Lanica's shares were suspended on the stock exchange on Monday pending an announcement from the company after The Sunday Times newspaper reported that it was expected to make a 500 million stg bid for CWS's petrol stations, undertaking, chemist, optician and department store businesses.
CWS is a co-operative business which focuses on food supermarkets.
Lanica is incorporated in the Channel Island of Guernsey and its shares staged a phenomenal rise last year after entrepeneur Regan took over when the stock was trading at 203 pence.
Last month, privately-owned retail and gambling group Littlewoods ruled out speculation that it might use Lanica as a vehicle for listing all or part of its business.
Shares in the company were last quoted at 1,937.5 pence, within sight of their 12-month trading high of 2,100 pence.
